name: CreateGithubCommitComment
description:
Create a comment on a specific GitHub commit.

Use this tool to add a comment to a specific commit on a GitHub repository using the commit's SHA identifier. Useful for discussing changes directly within the commit history. Be mindful of rate limiting when using this endpoint.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the GitHub repository. Name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub repository where the commit resides. It's not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: commit_sha
parameters.description: The SHA identifier of the commit to comment on. It uniquely identifies the commit within the repository.

parameters.name: comment_content
parameters.description: The text of the comment to be added to the commit. It should be a clear and concise message.

parameters.name: deprecated_line_number
parameters.description: Line number in the file to comment on. **Deprecated**. Use the `position_in_diff` instead.

value_schema.description: **Deprecated**. Use **position** parameter instead. Line number in the file to comment on.

parameters.name: relative_file_path
parameters.description: Relative path of the file to comment on within the repository.

value_schema.description: Relative path of the file to comment on.

parameters.name: line_index_in_diff
parameters.description: Line index in the diff to comment on.

value_schema.description: Line index in the diff to comment on.
